text: Bottled, Gift from Slovakia, Malt,caramel,roasted,light coffee and fruity aroma, Almost black, smaller lacing head, Heavy sweet taste, Full sticky body, Soft carbon, Pretty good one.

Bottle, courtesy of EuroSanta Cuso. Pours dark brown with a soft smooth foam. Aroma is light chocolate and coffee, quite roasty, but still as gentle as the foam promises. Medium body with a moderate sweetness and a soft texture. Very round and balanced. Palate continues like that. Some hints of the actual strength are there, but most of the ABV is well hidden. Great experience.

Draft at il Verne. Light brown, coffee like head, dark black, slightly red colour. Not very distinguishable aroma. Taste of coffee, almonds, unfortunately, too strong on alcohol taste. Nevertheless good bock, some surprises in the finish.

0,3l from tap at Pivobrana Festival Bratislava. black color, rather big tan head. smells of caramel, spices, some roast, licorice. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes caramel, licorice, some sweetness, spices, lightly fruity, hints of plums, pears. finishes with caramel and dark fruit notes. good stuff, drinks quite nice, I especially like the taste, quite creamy.

Bottle, thanks cuso, big frothy bubbly head, dark brown color with just a little reddish hues, earthy, coffee aroma with some dark bread, aroma of chocolate with some cola, hay and graininess, quite strong sourness, very light bitterness, light bodied. A bit old and not too exciting.
Vychladená fľaa, veľmi tmavá hnedo-čierna farba, nádherná karamelová pena, vôňa ovocno-kávová. Chuť kávová, čakal som alkohol, ale pije sa príjemne.

Bottle at home from European secret Santa, cheers!haY dark brown with lacing dark tan head, fruity with acetic fruity balsamic vinegar note. Full bodied, slick, light carbonation, fruity, definite balsamic vinegar notes, brown sauce, tartness not unpleasant but out of place. Would like to try a fresh bottle

Bottle (Diky, Cuso!): Very deep amber coloured with ruby spots, smaller stable creamy off-white head; sweet-bitter nose of toasted malt, nuts, milk-chocolate and caramel, shy hops in the Background; moderate to solid sweet-bitter flavour, medium bodied, smooth MF; lingering bitter and sweet finish, presenting the same flavours as the nose. Well crafted stuff, easy drinkable...

Many thanks to MisoW for this beer. 
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein sehr dunkelbraunes Bier mit geringer bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Geruch angenehm röstmalzig, Kakao, Schokolade.
Geschmack sehr schokoladig süß, Kakao, minimale Bitterkeit, einfach lecker dieser dunkel Bock. Danke Michal!
Wonderful superquaffy piwo donated by Cuso. Berries mixed up with caramel, some nuts and bit of sugar in the end. Very drinkable, sweetish and deep. Really to recommend.

Bottle from Cuso - with many thanks, Imro! The beer pours out in a deep dark brown colour with steady head and medium to smooth body. Wonderful aroma of malt and nuts. Taste of malt, nuts, barley, dark roasted hops and dark berries. Sweet but elegant finish. Wonderful and smooth to drink, I enjoyed it a lot.

Tap at RJ. Wonderful malty toasty bready caramely aroma with light fruits. These guys are becoming good at this. Clear dark brown colour, soft beige head, moderate duration. Taste is mostly malty, caramel, toasty. Moderate fruitiness, moderate alcohol poking out, but still bearable. Notes of coffee in the finish. Full body, chewy. Sipper, but good at that. Very good IMO.

BOTTLE 33CL from Cuso. Thanks, Imro!

Look: deep red-brown almost black with a mocha small frothy head with poor retention.
Aroma: yeasty with vanilla-like sweetness, licorice, chocolate, not too rich.
Taste: roasted malts, some hops, burnt sugar, sweet but not too sweet, body is quite light for 8 abv, a light acid note, a bit of phenolic touch but no alcohol.
For its big OG feels more like a tmavy on steroids than a bock.

Malzig schokoladiger aber kaum süßer Antrunk. Intensiver und auch etwas süßer im Mittelteil, vergorenen bananig, wenig herb. Rundes, nicht übertriebenes Bier das durch Summe Vollmundigkeit gefällt. 10/11/10/10/7/11

Ahhh. Sweet sexy Trnava. Bottle via Cuso the magnificent. Pours dark as a black steers raucous on a moonless prairie night. Small dark brown head. A dunkel as only that area of the world can perfect. Consumed whilst. Watching the female individual biathlon Olympics. And rooting for the smoking hot Slovak team. Strong nose of cocoa with a little dark roast thrown in for good measure. Body is full and abounds in dark sweet malts and cocoa. Finish is abrupt and final. Body is slick yet inviting. Some light raisin notes.

Bottle from brewery shop in Bratislava. Very dark brown color with small beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, ripe fruit, vanilla. Taste, dark malt, dark fruits, plum jam, vanilla, cocoa beans, coffee. Alcohol is recognizable but not in a bad way. Tasty, however 2012 version was more complex and bit better.

Bottle. Pours dark brown color, dark beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, vanilla. Taste is roasted malt, cocoa, coffee, dark fruits, alcohol is not hidden. Nice bitter roasted finish. Good one.

Bottle from brewery shop. Very dark brown, almost black color with thin brown head. Very nice sweet aroma; plums, raisins, vanilla, chocolate and alcohol. Taste is similar - cocoa/dark chocolate, vanilla, some dried fruits. Dry finish with some cherry sourness and alcohol too, yet its not boozy. Very nice beer.
